div.p: Dear sir and brother, at this moment the cart is moving. I am sending you the beautiful Interim, that is (Heb: Firmament) which will separate heaven and earth. Oh, the great sorrow! My brother sent it here; it is poorly transcribed and in several places the speech is confused; I had to copy it, it makes no sense. Yet I clearly notice that it all means nothing.
The best part is that it is all very crudely presented, and yet ours must all become godless villains if they want to accept it.
Those from Strasbourg are said to have secretly ridden away from Augsburg; no one knows what it means (means?).
Now they want to negotiate with our envoys before they send them out; previously the subordinates let the opposition and free surrender happen; now it is different.
Send me back the Interim. Praying to God for us. Send this letter to Marcell. I would like, if you have this pretty thing copied, that he would also read it.
To Master Heinrich Bullinger in Zurich.
